title: Optgroup
post:
{{Sidebar("html/reference/elements")}} The **``** [HTML](/blog/Web/HTML) element creates a grouping of options within a {{HTMLElement("select")}} element. In [customizable ` ``` ```css interactive-example label { display: block; margin-bottom: 10px; } ``` > [!NOTE] > Optgroup elements may not be nested. ## Attributes This element includes the [global attributes](/blog/Web/HTML/Reference/Global_attributes). - [`disabled`](/blog/Web/HTML/Reference/Attributes/disabled) - : If this Boolean attribute is set, none of the items in this option group is selectable. Often browsers grey out such control and it won't receive any browsing events, like mouse clicks or focus-related ones. - `label` - : The name of the group of options, which the browser can use when labeling the options in the user interface. This attribute is mandatory if this element is used. ## Examples ```html ``` ### Result {{EmbedLiveSample("Examples")}} ## Technical summary
Content categories None.
Permitted content Zero or more {{HTMLElement("option")}} elements. In customizable select elements, a {{htmlelement("legend")}} element is permitted as a child of <optgroup>.
Tag omission The start tag is mandatory. The end tag is optional if this element is immediately followed by another <optgroup> element, or if the parent element has no more content.
Permitted parents A {{HTMLElement("select")}} element.
Implicit ARIA role group
Permitted ARIA roles No role permitted
DOM interface {{domxref("HTMLOptGroupElement")}}
